      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String[] createCode(java.lang.String colours, int size)
      Returns an array of some length containing randomly generated characters (representing colours), from a String of colours and an integer representing the amount of colours to generate.
      static java.lang.String displayGame(java.lang.String[][] guess, java.lang.String[][] clues)
      Returns a string beginning with headers, followed by 16 '*', followed by the guess, followed by the clues up to the turn in which the user is on.
      static java.lang.String[] findColourCorrect(java.lang.String[] code, java.lang.String[] userInput)
      Returns an array containing a "w" for every String in the user input that has the same value as the String in the code but different position.
      static java.lang.String[] findFullyCorrect(java.lang.String[] code, java.lang.String[] guess)
      Returns an array containing a "b" for every correctly positioned colour in the guess.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static java.lang.String[] removeFullyCorrect(java.lang.String[] code, java.lang.String[] guess)
      Returns an array that is the result of removing every correctly positioned colour in the user input, and adding the colours that were not removed to a new array
      static boolean valid(java.lang.String[] userInput, java.lang.String colour, int size)
      Returns true if guess is valid (correct size and valid colours entered) or false if guess is invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • createCode

        public static java.lang.String[] createCode(java.lang.String colours,
                                            int size)
        Returns an array of some length containing randomly generated characters (representing colours), from a String of colours and an integer representing the amount of colours to generate. The returned array is used as a code which a user then has to guess.
        Parameters:
        colours - possible colours to generate a code from
        size - length of code
        Returns:
        an array of randomly generated characters (representing colours)

      • valid

        public static boolean valid(java.lang.String[] userInput,
                            java.lang.String colour,
                            int size)
        Returns true if guess is valid (correct size and valid colours entered) or false if guess is invalid.
        Parameters:
        userInput - the guess from the user
        colour - possible colours
        size - length of code
        Returns:
        true if guess is valid (correct characters and size) or false if guess is invalid (incorrect characters and size)

      • findFullyCorrect

        public static java.lang.String[] findFullyCorrect(java.lang.String[] code,
                                                  java.lang.String[] guess)
        Returns an array containing a "b" for every correctly positioned colour in the guess.
        Parameters:
        code - the randomly generated code
        guess - the user's guess
        Returns:
        a list containing a "b" for every correctly positioned colour in the guess

      • removeFullyCorrect

        public static java.lang.String[] removeFullyCorrect(java.lang.String[] code,
                                                    java.lang.String[] guess)
        Returns an array that is the result of removing every correctly positioned colour in the user input, and adding the colours that were not removed to a new array
        Parameters:
        code - the randomly generated code
        guess - the user's guess
        Returns:
        an array that is the result of removing from the first array all chars that are the same and in the same position in the second array

      • findColourCorrect

        public static java.lang.String[] findColourCorrect(java.lang.String[] code,
                                                   java.lang.String[] userInput)
        Returns an array containing a "w" for every String in the user input that has the same value as the String in the code but different position.
        Parameters:
        code - the randomly generated code after fully correct elements are removed
        userInput - the user's guess after fully correct elements are removed
        Returns:
        an array that is the result of removing from the first array all chars that are the same and in the same position in the second array

      • displayGame

        public static java.lang.String displayGame(java.lang.String[][] guess,
                                           java.lang.String[][] clues)
        Returns a string beginning with headers, followed by 16 '*', followed by the guess, followed by the clues up to the turn in which the user is on.
        Parameters:
        guess - the user's guesses
        clues - the clues
        Returns:
        a string beginning with headers, followed by 16 '*', followed by the guess, followed by the clues up to the turn in which the user is on
